news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: CarbonPool, aiming to balance insurance with carbon credits, secured an €11.2 million funding round led by Heartcore Capital and Vorwerk Ventures, with HCS Capital, Revent Ventures among others participating. The funds are earmarked for underwriting the carbon credit markets.

properties.growth_insight_description: CarbonPool may be growing as it has successfully raised $12 million in seed funding from climate-focused investors, which indicates a strong financial backing and confidence from the investment community in its business model. The appointment of a Chief Commercial Officer suggests that the company is scaling its operations and strengthening its leadership team to support its growth strategy. These developments demonstrate an expansion in both financial resources and human capital, which are critical indicators of a company's growth trajectory.

about_short_description.short_description: CarbonPool promotes a transition to net zero by offering in-kind insurance against unforeseen reductions in or reversals of carbon credits.

product.name: Carbon Shortfall Insurance
product.description: Covers unexpected carbon credit shortfalls due to lower-than-expected yields, natural disasters, or other accidents.

product.name: Carbon Reversal Insurance
product.description: Replaces sequestered carbon lost due to reversal events, ensuring the integrity of emissions reduction efforts.

product.name: Unintended Emissions Insurance
product.description: Protects against unintended emissions from temporary disruptions in carbon capture technologies or machinery breakdowns.

product.name: Customized Risk Assessment
product.description: Tailor-made risk models for buyers, developers, or aggregators of carbon credits, using environmental and weather modeling.

product.name: Claims Paid in Carbon Credits
product.description: Compensates shortfalls with high-quality carbon credits from CarbonPool’s portfolio, ensuring quality and similarity.
